intro: Gossypianthus, commonly known as the woolly sunflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. These plants are native to South Africa and are characterized by their hairy, woolly leaves and showy, often yellow or orange flowers. They typically grow in arid or semi-arid environments and are adapted to withstand drought conditions. Gossypianthus species are often found in rocky or sandy soils and are prized for their ornamental value. The flowers are usually small and clustered, producing a bright, sun-like appearance.
